Key Match Events: Steph Curry scored 37 points, nine assists, and six rebounds, including the Warriors' final 12 points.
Luka Dončić missed a critical turnaround fadeaway with under a minute to go.
Steph Curry nailed a three-pointer with 27.5 seconds left to secure the win for the Warriors.
The Mavericks missed five of their last six shots and had one possession end in a turnover.
Pre-Game Insights: Golden State coach Steve Kerr discussed strategies to guard Luka Dončić, mentioning his three-point shooting percentage and the challenge of guarding him one-on-one.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Dončić commented on the Mavericks' late-game execution, stating it could be way better.
Coach Jason Kidd reflected on the loss, noting the team's need to improve and the positive aspects of the game despite the loss.
Luka Dončić mentioned his adjustment to playing off the ball more this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Quentin Grimes played 29 effective minutes against the Warriors, contributing six points, six rebounds, and no turnovers.
Golden State had 18 offensive rebounds and 13 second-chance points.
The Warriors' defensive-minded starting unit featured Trayce Jackson-Davis, De'Anthony Melton, Draymond Green, Andrew Wiggins, and Steph Curry, with Buddy Hield coming off the bench.
